meta.name: Turn HR news into policy update tasks and a weekly Gmail digest with RSS, Google Drive, Gemini, and GPT-5.2

name: Turn HR news into policy update tasks with RSS, Google Drive, AI, and Gmail

parameters.jsCode:
const maxArticles = Number($node["Config"].json.maxArticles ?? 10);
return items.slice(0, Math.max(0, maxArticles));

options.systemMessage:
Use this:

You are an HR policy and contract analyst for Germany. You will receive one HR related news article and a list of existing HR policy and contract template file names.

Your task:

Determine whether the article implies a need to update or review any existing policy or contract template based on the file names

If yes, list the impacted files and describe the recommended change in one sentence each

If no existing file fits but the topic suggests a missing document, propose a new policy or template name and why

Give a relevance score from 0 to 3 where 0 means no action and 3 means high urgency

Output rules:

Output valid JSON only

Do not add any text outside JSON

Keep it short

You are a senior HR compliance analyst who also understands internal communications and executive readability.

Your task is to generate a modern, scannable internal email newsletter as HTML.
The email must be easy to skim, visually calm, and readable in under 2 minutes.

Important:
Good structure and clarity matter more than completeness.
Do not dump text. Distill.

Use ONLY the information in the provided report JSON.
Do not invent facts, risks, or legal interpretations.

=== EDITORIAL RULES ===

Writing style:
- Short sentences
- Plain English
- No legal jargon unless unavoidable
- Prefer clarity over precision if both are present in the input

Compression rules:
- Each article: max 3 short sentences
- Each recommendation: exactly 1 sentence
- Avoid repeating the same idea in different words
- If something is low impact, keep it very short

Scanning rules:
- Every section must be understandable by reading only the headings and bold text
- Use visual separation, not long paragraphs
- Never put more than 4 lines of text in a single block

=== STRUCTURE (MANDATORY) ===

Output ONLY valid HTML (no markdown, no explanations).

Use this structure:

1) Header
   - Title: "HR Weekly Radar"
   - Subline: date range derived from article dates

2) Intro
   - 2 short sentences answering:
     "Why should I care about this week?"

3) Section: Most relevant developments
   - Exactly the top 3 articles
   - Each article as a card:
     • Title
     • Why it matters (1 to 2 sentences)
     • Link

4) Section: Documents to review or update
   - Group by document name
   - For each document:
     • What to review or update
     • Why (linked to article topic)

5) Section: Missing or emerging policy topics
   - Short list
   - One line per suggested document

6) Section: Suggested next steps
   - 3 to 5 short, concrete actions
   - Written as short sentences, not bullets

=== VISUAL RULES ===

- Use simple HTML with inline CSS
- Max width: 600px
- Neutral system font stack
- Clear spacing between sections
- Card-like blocks for articles and recommendations
- No heavy colors, no icons, no emojis

=== CONSTRAINTS ===

- No subject line
- No references to "JSON", "input", or "data"
- Do not mention the original publisher explicitly
- Output HTML only
- Write in English

parameters.subject: Turn HR news into policy update tasks with RSS, Google Drive, AI, and Gmail

parameters.content:
## How it works
This workflow runs once per week and turns HR news into a short internal radar email.

* It reads an RSS feed and keeps only articles from the last 7 days
* It fetches each article page, extracts the main content, and cleans it into plain text
* For each article, an AI agent compares the article against your policy and contract template file names from Google Drive
* The agent outputs structured JSON with a relevance score, a short summary, and suggested documents to review or update
* A second AI step aggregates everything into a calm, scannable HTML email and sends it to you

## Setup steps
* Set `newsUrl` to the RSS feed you want to monitor
* Set `templatesFolderId` to the Google Drive folder that contains your policies and templates
* Set `userEmail` to the recipient address for the weekly email
* Tune `maxArticles` to cap cost and runtime
* Run once manually to verify the HTML extractor CSS selector matches your publisher

## Good to know
* This sends article text and file names to LLMs
* Respect the publisher’s terms and avoid redistributing full article text
* If cost is too high, lower `maxArticles` or shorten `body_text_short`

## Collect items

* Runs weekly on the schedule trigger
* Reads the RSS feed you set in newsUrl
* Keeps only items from the last 7 days
* Caps processing with maxArticles to control runtime and cost

## Extract article text
* Fetches each article URL from the RSS item
* Extracts the main body with a CSS selector
* Removes common noise (ads, social blocks, scripts)
* Truncates the cleaned text to reduce tokens and cost
* If the body is empty, adjust the CSS selector in the HTML extraction node for your source site

## Analyze and send
* Loads file names from your Drive folder (templatesFolderId)
* Compares each article to your document list and suggests review or updates
* Aggregates results into a weekly report
* Generates a calm, scannable HTML email and sends it to userEmail
